moves.1. c4 e5: English opening and e5 is usually referred to as the reverse sicillian
moves.4... Bc5 5. e3 O-O 6. Nge2 d6 7. O-O Bb6: This is the main aim of the english opening. Allowing black to build a centre knowing that it can be dealt with.
moves.8... Re8 9. d5: Establishes a strong central bridgehead controlling space
moves.9... Ne7 10. Na4 Ba5 11. b3 Bf5 12. h3 h: A little better was e4 controlling space and preventing whites e4
Black's 1st inaccuracy. better was c5 doubling the coverage of d4 and also protecting b4.
moves.18. b4: Notice that each pawn move has a purpose. In this case space control giving whites pieces more freedom
moves.18... Red8 19. Qe2 Qc8 20. Rfd1: Bringing the R into the game and aiming for control of the semi open d-file
moves.20... Qe6 21. Kh2: Ready to protect h3 if the B gets involved in exchanges over e4
moves.21... Kh7 22. Rd2 Nc8 23. Rc1 Ne7 24. f3: Dont see the point of Kh8? better was f6 supporting e5 and giving the LSB an escape route
moves.26. Rcd1 Nf6 27. h4: Grabbing more space and preparing for Bh3 to attack the Q
moves.27... Qc8 28. Bh3 Qb7 29. b5 c5 30. Qe3: Passive. Better was Nh5 which prevents g4 as this would allow Nf4 giving a strong N in whites territory and pushing the LSB off of the good diagonal
moves.31. g4 f6 32. h5 Bf7 33. Bf1: Black is building an attack Q-side so this to counteract it
moves.33... Qc8 34. Qe2 Qb8 35. Kg1 Ba5 36. Be: White has held a small advantage for the last 30 moves but good play from black has puled the game back to level.
moves.50. Bxf6: Now an attempt to open up the game in front of the K
moves.50... gxf6 51. Nxf6+ Kf7 52. Nxd7 Qxd7 5: better was Nc3 preparing to swing the troops for a k-side attack
moves.54... Nd4 55. Nxd4 cxd4 56. Rb3b7 Qe6 57: mistake? looking to exchange R for N & B.  bettre was Ra6 or a4
moves.61... Qf6: and black jumps at the chance. setting up for Bh4 and Qf4 threatening a mate
The noose is tightening so white has to go on the attack
moves.65... Nf7 66. Qg6+ Kf8 67. Rxf7+ Bxf7 68: A rare endgame miscalculation by white. Qc1 seems good but correct was Qd2 lookiing to get to h2 and force a Q swap
moves.69... d3 70. Qf1 dxe2 71. Qxe2 Be7: Aiming at Bxc5 and again the mate threat is on
moves.72. Qg2 Qh4+ 73. Qh2 Qe1+ 74. Qg1 Qxg1+: And now the trickiest standard mate. K & 2B
moves.75... Bxc5+ 76. Kg2 Bxa3 77. Kf1 Bc4+ 78: And now it really is academic.
moves.81. Kf3 Bg3 82. g5 Kg7 83. h6+ Kg6 84. e: A good even game which turned on one miscalculation  in the endgame. Well played sir. A pleasure to play against a gentleman.
